review: This thing works as claimed.  The setup is easy, you just need an HDMI port and a free USB port. If you don't want to waste a USB port you can use the included power supply.  The HD picture quality, wireless link, and rf remote all are perfect - no problems whatsoever.  My only issue is that registration is required on the Roku website and a valid credit card is required to open an account there.  Now that my registration is completed I will go back to the Roku website and try to delete my credit card.  If I can't delete my credit card I will cancel my account.  If any of these actions results in my registration being canceled and my Roku not working I will be back with a one star rating.
author: Lawrence Wharton

review: ...not very easy to use and most channels are not free, thus a subscription is necessary. It is nowhere near similar others such as Apple TV or Netflix and more, but covers a relative range of channels, some for free but most by subscription.

review: Easy to set-up, great to use. I bought it for travel and it has worked well, even with somewhat weak hotel WiFi. I am not saying that it works without WiFi or very poor WiFi but have used it very successfully in a wide variety of "so-so" hotel WiFi networks. Interface is dead simple, just like the "full-size" Roku boxes.
